channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report E-2023070072
item.description:
Report E-2023070072

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: PEARL
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: June 15, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of calcium hypochlorite was damaged and released all its contents to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from E3 to remediate the site. The crew identified the released material and contained it in one (1) 55-gallon open top vented poly drum. E3 labeled and staged the drum onsite to be profiled and disposed of by R+L personnel.

item.title: Report X-2023061622
item.description:
Report X-2023061622

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-24T15:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was dropped on its side during the process of unloading, causing one of the tops to leak due to not being properly closed. Upon discovering the package was leaking, box was turned upright, so all bottles were turned upright, and all tops were successfully closed tigher. DescribePack: Cap on top of the bottle was not entirely closed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was turned in upright condition, and Oil Dry was applied to any remaining liquid spillage.
